Homework is My Wife | Original

Home 2012.01

This post was originally written in Chinese and published on Qzone.

It suddenly struck me how beautiful love is. In this vast world, among countless people, she suddenly entered my life. Now, we strive together in this boundless world, and I’m no longer fighting alone. No matter what happens, she’s always there to support me. Nothing is more motivating than that…

For a young person in their thirties, the moment of happiness is when they return home after a day of hard work and see her. Those are some of the so-called true joys. She asks, “Husband, are you tired?” He replies, “With you, my wife, I’m never tired.” Please use your imagination to picture this harmonious and warm scene…

Initially, people seek partners for various reasons, such as family pressure, envy of others, a sense of fun, or to satisfy desires. But eventually, at some point, they suddenly begin to understand the more precious aspects of love—emotional resonance. Resonance, like two mandarin ducks stopping by a lake. One calls out, the other responds; one chirps, the other hums. They communicate with great understanding, and their communication has elevated to an emotional level. Then, the male duck takes a few steps forward and stomps on her foot. She reaches out and playfully hits him, saying, “You’re annoying, how dare you bully me!” Then, the male duck dances and flies away, and she chases after him. They fly just a millimeter above the lake, their feet skimming the water, creating ripples, and then they go off to have fun in the marsh…

And me, at this moment, I need to go do my chemistry homework. Yes, homework, that’s my “she”…
